definition: mental or spiritual cultivation
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth
nature/character/property/quality/attribute/sexuality/sex/gender/suffix forming adjective from verb/suffix forming noun from adjective, corresponding to -ness or -ity/essence/CL:個|个[ge4]
to cultivate the heart and nurture the character (idiom); to improve oneself by meditation

sentences.chinese: 二氢吡啶是一种非营养性添加剂。

sentences.english: Practicing Quan is to calm your mind.
sentences.chinese: 太极拳更重视修身养性，心神安静。

sentences.english: Second, can be self-cultivation, to ease the violent emotions and calm your mind.
sentences.chinese: 可以修身养性，缓解暴戾的情绪，平和你的心态。

sentences.english: Objective To investigate the clinical effects of trophic feeding in preterm infants.
sentences.chinese: 目的探讨早产儿微量营养性喂养的临床作用。

sentences.english: The culture of the mind is vital.
sentences.chinese: 修心养性是极其重要的。

sentences.english: Conclusion The non-nutritive sucking combined with massaging and touching can promote gastrointestinal development of neonates.
sentences.chinese: 结论非营养性吸吮和抚触可促进新生儿胃肠道发育。

sentences.english: In conclusion, phillyrin has anti-obesity effect to nutritive obesity mice.
sentences.chinese: 提示连翘苷对营养性肥胖小鼠有一定的减肥作用。

sentences.english: The typical patient has obvious signs of advanced nutritional cirrhosis .
sentences.chinese: 典型的病人有明显的晚期营养性肝硬变的体症。

sentences.english: Effects of obesity on sperm in diet-induced obesity rats;
sentences.chinese: 提示连翘苷对营养性肥胖小鼠有一定的减肥作用。

sentences.english: Moral reform is the effort to throw off sleep.
sentences.chinese: 修身养性就是为摆脱睡眠而付出的努力。

definition: to cultivate the heart and nurture the character (idiom); to improve oneself by meditation
meditation
to concentrate on the task/to curb one's evil instincts
to rest/to recuperate/to regain composure

to free the mind from worries

to cultivate one's mind/to build character
to strengthen one's body/to keep fit/to build up one's health (through exercise, nutrition etc)
to devote oneself to spiritual development (esp. Buddhism or Daoism)/to devote oneself to perfecting one's art or craft
the way of maintaining good health
tranquil/calm

lust
